p: These enzyme assays can be performed in 96-well microplate readers [ 40– 42], or in traditional cuvette-based spectrophotometers or spectrofluorometers [ 43– 45]. However, miniaturisation of assays by adapting them to a 96-well format is beneficial as it reduces the volumes of reagents required, is cost-efficient and enables faster testing suitable for screening large libraries of plants, extracts or natural products [ 46].
